Typealiases.html#/s:16OpenCoreLocation17.name: CLLocationDegrees
Typealiases.html#/s:16OpenCoreLocation17.abstract: Represents latitude or longitude values in degrees.

Typealiases.html#/s:16OpenCoreLocation18.name: CLLocationAccuracy
Typealiases.html#/s:16OpenCoreLocation18.abstract: Represents the accuracy of location data in meters.

Typealiases.html#/s:16OpenCoreLocation23.name: CLLocationSpeedAccuracy
Typealiases.html#/s:16OpenCoreLocation23.abstract: Represents the accuracy of a speed measurement in meters per second.

Typealiases.html#/s:16OpenCoreLocation27.name: CLLocationDirectionAccuracy
Typealiases.html#/s:16OpenCoreLocation27.abstract: Represents the accuracy of a directional measurement in degrees.

Structs/SendableCLLocation.html#/s:16Ope.name: altitude
Structs/SendableCLLocation.html#/s:16Ope.abstract: The altitude of the location in meters.

Structs/SendableCLLocation.html#/s:16Ope.name: horizontalAccuracy
Structs/SendableCLLocation.html#/s:16Ope.abstract: The horizontal accuracy of the location in meters.

Structs/SendableCLLocation.html#/s:16Ope.name: verticalAccuracy
Structs/SendableCLLocation.html#/s:16Ope.abstract: The vertical accuracy of the location in meters.

Structs/SendableCLLocation.html#/s:16Ope.name: timestamp
Structs/SendableCLLocation.html#/s:16Ope.abstract: The timestamp when the location was determined.

Structs/SendableCLLocation.html#/s:16Ope.name: course
Structs/SendableCLLocation.html#/s:16Ope.abstract: The course of the device in degrees relative to true north.

Structs/SendableCLLocation.html#/s:16Ope.name: courseAccuracy
Structs/SendableCLLocation.html#/s:16Ope.abstract: The accuracy of the course measurement in degrees.

Structs/SendableCLLocation.html#/s:16Ope.name: speed
Structs/SendableCLLocation.html#/s:16Ope.abstract: The speed of the device in meters per second.

Structs/SendableCLLocation.html#/s:16Ope.name: speedAccuracy
Structs/SendableCLLocation.html#/s:16Ope.abstract: The accuracy of the speed measurement in meters per second.

Structs/SendableCLLocation.html#/s:16Ope.name: description
Structs/SendableCLLocation.html#/s:16Ope.abstract: Returns a user-friendly string representation of the location.

Structs/SendableCLLocation.html#/s:16Ope.name: debugDescription
Structs/SendableCLLocation.html#/s:16Ope.abstract: Returns a detailed string representation for debugging.

Structs/CLLocationUpdate.html#/s:16OpenC.name: isStationary
Structs/CLLocationUpdate.html#/s:16OpenC.abstract: A Boolean value that indicates whether the user is stationary.

Structs/CLLocationUpdate.html#/s:16OpenC.name: accuracyLimited
Structs/CLLocationUpdate.html#/s:16OpenC.abstract: A Boolean value that indicates if location accuracy is limited.

Structs/CLLocationUpdate.html#/s:16OpenC.name: authorizationDenied
Structs/CLLocationUpdate.html#/s:16OpenC.abstract: A Boolean value that indicates if the authorization is denied.

Structs/CLLocationUpdate.html#/s:16OpenC.name: authorizationDeniedGlobally
Structs/CLLocationUpdate.html#/s:16OpenC.abstract: A Boolean value that indicates if the authorization is denied globally (e.g., system-wide setting).

Structs/CLLocationUpdate.html#/s:16OpenC.name: authorizationRequestInProgress
Structs/CLLocationUpdate.html#/s:16OpenC.abstract: A Boolean value that indicates if an authorization request is in progress.

Structs/CLLocationUpdate.html#/s:16OpenC.name: authorizationRestricted
Structs/CLLocationUpdate.html#/s:16OpenC.abstract: A Boolean value that indicates if the authorization is restricted (e.g., parental controls).

Structs/CLLocationUpdate.html#/s:16OpenC.name: insufficientlyInUse
Structs/CLLocationUpdate.html#/s:16OpenC.abstract: A Boolean value that indicates if the app is insufficiently authorized for the intended use.

Structs/CLLocationUpdate.html#/s:16OpenC.name: locationUnavailable
Structs/CLLocationUpdate.html#/s:16OpenC.abstract: A Boolean value that indicates if the location services are unavailable.

Structs/CLLocationUpdate.html#/s:16OpenC.name: serviceSessionRequired
Structs/CLLocationUpdate.html#/s:16OpenC.abstract: A Boolean value that indicates if a service session is required for the updates.

Structs/CLLocationCoordinate2D.html#/s:1.name: init(latitude:longitude:)
Structs/CLLocationCoordinate2D.html#/s:1.abstract: Initializes a coordinate with specific latitude and longitude.

Structs/CLLocationCoordinate2D.html#/s:1.name: latitude
Structs/CLLocationCoordinate2D.html#/s:1.abstract: The latitude of the coordinate in degrees.

Structs/CLLocationCoordinate2D.html#/s:1.name: longitude
Structs/CLLocationCoordinate2D.html#/s:1.abstract: The longitude of the coordinate in degrees.

Structs/CLLocationCoordinate2D.html#/s:1.name: distance(to:)
Structs/CLLocationCoordinate2D.html#/s:1.abstract: Calculates the distance to another coordinate using the haversine formula.

Structs/CLLocationCoordinate2D.html#/s:1.name: isValid
Structs/CLLocationCoordinate2D.html#/s:1.abstract: Checks if this coordinate is valid (within acceptable latitude/longitude ranges).

Structs/CLError/Code.html#/s:16OpenCoreL.name: denied
Structs/CLError/Code.html#/s:16OpenCoreL.abstract: The app is not authorized to use location services.

Structs/CLError/Code.html#/s:16OpenCoreL.name: headingFailure
Structs/CLError/Code.html#/s:16OpenCoreL.abstract: The location manager failed to retrieve heading data.

Structs/CLError/Code.html#/s:16OpenCoreL.name: regionMonitoringDenied
Structs/CLError/Code.html#/s:16OpenCoreL.abstract: Region monitoring is denied by the user.

Structs/CLError/Code.html#/s:16OpenCoreL.name: regionMonitoringFailure
Structs/CLError/Code.html#/s:16OpenCoreL.abstract: A failure occurred while monitoring a region.

Structs/CLError/Code.html#/s:16OpenCoreL.name: geocodeFoundNoResult
Structs/CLError/Code.html#/s:16OpenCoreL.abstract: No results were found for the geocode request.

Structs/CLError/Code.html#/s:16OpenCoreL.name: deferredNotUpdatingLocation
Structs/CLError/Code.html#/s:16OpenCoreL.abstract: Deferred updates were canceled because location updates were not occurring.

Structs/CLError/Code.html#/s:16OpenCoreL.name: deferredAccuracyTooLow
Structs/CLError/Code.html#/s:16OpenCoreL.abstract: Deferred updates were canceled due to insufficient accuracy.

Structs/CLError/Code.html#/s:16OpenCoreL.name: deferredDistanceFiltered
Structs/CLError/Code.html#/s:16OpenCoreL.abstract: Deferred updates were canceled because the distance filter was too small.

Structs/CLError/Code.html#/s:16OpenCoreL.name: deferredCanceled
Structs/CLError/Code.html#/s:16OpenCoreL.abstract: Deferred updates were canceled by the system.

Structs/CLError/Code.html.name: Code
Structs/CLError/Code.html.abstract: Defines specific error codes that can occur within CoreLocation.

Structs/CLError.html#/s:16OpenCoreLocati.name: alternateRegion
Structs/CLError.html#/s:16OpenCoreLocati.abstract: In a regionMonitoringResponseDelayed error, this property provides an alternative region that the location services can more effectively monitor.

Structs/CLBeaconIdentityConstraint.html#.name: uuid
Structs/CLBeaconIdentityConstraint.html#.abstract: The unique identifier of the beacon’s proximity UUID.

Structs/CLBeaconIdentityConstraint.html#.name: major
Structs/CLBeaconIdentityConstraint.html#.abstract: The major value that identifies one or more beacons (optional).

Structs/CLBeaconIdentityConstraint.html#.name: minor
Structs/CLBeaconIdentityConstraint.html#.abstract: The minor value that identifies a specific beacon (optional).

Structs/CLBeaconIdentityConstraint.html#.name: init(uuid:major:minor:)
Structs/CLBeaconIdentityConstraint.html#.abstract: Initializes a constraint for a specific beacon.

Structs/CLBeaconIdentityConstraint.html#.name: description
Structs/CLBeaconIdentityConstraint.html#.abstract: A user-friendly description of the beacon identity constraint.

Structs/CLBeaconIdentityConstraint.html#.name: debugDescription
Structs/CLBeaconIdentityConstraint.html#.abstract: A debug-friendly description of the beacon identity constraint.

Structs/CLBeaconIdentityConstraint.html.name: CLBeaconIdentityConstraint
Structs/CLBeaconIdentityConstraint.html.abstract: Represents the constraints used to identify a specific iBeacon.

Structs/CLError.html.name: CLError
Structs/CLError.html.abstract: Represents errors that can occur when using CoreLocation.

Structs/CLLocationUpdate.html.name: CLLocationUpdate
Structs/CLLocationUpdate.html.abstract: A structure that contains the location information the framework delivers with each update.

Structs/CNPostalAddress.html.name: CNPostalAddress
Structs/CNPostalAddress.html.abstract: A cross-platform struct to represent a postal address in a Linux-compatible way.

Protocols/LocationProviderContract.html#.name: start()
Protocols/LocationProviderContract.html#.abstract: Optional method to start location updates, if applicable

Protocols/LocationProviderContract.html#.name: stop()
Protocols/LocationProviderContract.html#.abstract: Optional method to stop location updates, if applicable

Protocols/LocationProviderContract.html#.name: poolInterval
Protocols/LocationProviderContract.html#.abstract: Number of seconds to check for new location when startUpdatingLocation

Protocols/CLLocationManagerDelegate.html.name: locationManager(_:didUpdateLocations:)
Protocols/CLLocationManagerDelegate.html.abstract: Tells the delegate that new location data is available.

Protocols/CLLocationManagerDelegate.html.name: locationManager(_:didFailWithError:)
Protocols/CLLocationManagerDelegate.html.abstract: Tells the delegate that the location manager was unable to retrieve a location value.

Protocols/CLLocationManagerDelegate.html.name: locationManager(_:didChangeAuthorization:)
Protocols/CLLocationManagerDelegate.html.abstract: Tells the delegate that the authorization status changed for the application.

Protocols/CLLocationManagerDelegate.html.name: locationManager(_:didUpdateHeading:)
Protocols/CLLocationManagerDelegate.html.abstract: Tells the delegate that the heading information was updated.

Protocols/CLLocationManagerDelegate.html.name: locationManager(_:didChangeAccuracyAuthorization:)
Protocols/CLLocationManagerDelegate.html.abstract: Tells the delegate that the device’s location accuracy authorization changed.

Protocols/CLLocationManagerDelegate.html.name: locationManager(_:didEnterRegion:)
Protocols/CLLocationManagerDelegate.html.abstract: Tells the delegate that the user entered the specified region.

Protocols/CLLocationManagerDelegate.html.name: locationManager(_:didExitRegion:)
Protocols/CLLocationManagerDelegate.html.abstract: Tells the delegate that the user left the specified region.

Protocols/CLLocationManagerDelegate.html.name: locationManager(_:monitoringDidFailFor:withError:)
Protocols/CLLocationManagerDelegate.html.abstract: Tells the delegate that a region monitoring error occurred.

Protocols/CLLocationManagerDelegate.html.name: locationManager(_:didStartMonitoringFor:)
Protocols/CLLocationManagerDelegate.html.abstract: Tells the delegate that monitoring for a region started.

Protocols/CLLocationManagerDelegate.html.name: locationManager(_:didDetermineState:for:)
Protocols/CLLocationManagerDelegate.html.abstract: Tells the delegate the state of the specified region.

Protocols/CLGeocoderImplementationContra.name: isGeocoding
Protocols/CLGeocoderImplementationContra.abstract: Indicates whether the geocoder is currently processing a request.

Protocols/CLGeocoderImplementationContra.name: geocodeAddressString(_:in:preferredLocale:)
Protocols/CLGeocoderImplementationContra.abstract: Converts an address string into a list of placemarks asynchronously.

Protocols/CLGeocoderImplementationContra.name: reverseGeocodeLocation(_:preferredLocale:)
Protocols/CLGeocoderImplementationContra.abstract: Converts a location into a human-readable address asynchronously.

Protocols/CLGeocoderImplementationContra.name: CLGeocoderImplementationContract
Protocols/CLGeocoderImplementationContra.abstract: Defines the interface that geocoding services must implement.

Protocols/CLLocationManagerDelegate.html.name: CLLocationManagerDelegate
Protocols/CLLocationManagerDelegate.html.abstract: The CLLocationManagerDelegate protocol defines methods that you implement to receive and handle location-related events.

Functions.html#/s:16OpenCoreLocation29CL.name: CLLocationCoordinate2DIsValid(_:)
Functions.html#/s:16OpenCoreLocation29CL.abstract: Determines whether the given coordinate is valid.

Enums/CLLocationManagerHeadingFilter.htm.abstract: A change of at least ten degrees is required for an update.

Enums/CLLocationManagerHeadingFilter.htm.name: fifteenDegrees
Enums/CLLocationManagerHeadingFilter.htm.abstract: A change of at least fifteen degrees is required for an update.

Enums/CLDistanceFilter.html#/s:16OpenCor.name: hundredMeters

Enums/CLDistanceFilter.html#/s:16OpenCor.name: debugDescription
Enums/CLDistanceFilter.html#/s:16OpenCor.abstract: A debug-friendly description of the distance filter.

Enums/CLDeviceOrientation.html#/s:16Open.name: portrait

Enums/CLDeviceOrientation.html#/s:16Open.name: portraitUpsideDown

Enums/CLDeviceOrientation.html#/s:16Open.abstract: The device is laid flat, with the screen facing upwards.

Enums/CLDeviceOrientation.html#/s:16Open.name: faceDown

Enums/CLAuthorizationStatus.html#/s:16Op.name: restricted
Enums/CLAuthorizationStatus.html#/s:16Op.abstract: This app is not authorized to use location services.

Enums/CLAuthorizationStatus.html#/s:16Op.name: denied
Enums/CLAuthorizationStatus.html#/s:16Op.abstract: The user explicitly denied the use of location services for this app or

Enums/CLAuthorizationStatus.html#/s:16Op.name: authorizedWhenInUse
Enums/CLAuthorizationStatus.html#/s:16Op.abstract: This app is authorized to use location services only while it is in the foreground.

Enums/CLAuthorizationStatus.html#/s:16Op.name: authorizedAlways

Enums/CLAuthorizationStatus.html#/s:16Op.abstract: A user-friendly description of the authorization status.

Enums/CLAuthorizationStatus.html#/s:16Op.name: debugDescription
Enums/CLAuthorizationStatus.html#/s:16Op.abstract: A debug-friendly description of the authorization status.

Enums/CLActivityType.html#/s:16OpenCoreL.name: other

Enums/CLActivityType.html#/s:16OpenCoreL.name: automotiveNavigation

Enums/CLActivityType.html#/s:16OpenCoreL.name: fitness

Enums/CLActivityType.html#/s:16OpenCoreL.name: otherNavigation

Enums/CLActivityType.html#/s:16OpenCoreL.name: debugDescription
Enums/CLActivityType.html#/s:16OpenCoreL.abstract: A debug-friendly description of the activity type.

Enums/CLAccuracyAuthorization.html.abstract: The accuracy level the app is authorized to use.

Enums/CLActivityType.html.name: CLActivityType
Enums/CLActivityType.html.abstract: The type of user activity associated with the location updates.

Enums/CLAuthorizationStatus.html.name: CLAuthorizationStatus
Enums/CLAuthorizationStatus.html.abstract: The authorization status for the application, indicating whether it can use location services.

Enums/CLDeviceOrientation.html.name: CLDeviceOrientation
Enums/CLDeviceOrientation.html.abstract: Represents the physical orientation of a device.

Classes/CLLocationUtils.html#/s:16OpenCo.abstract: Validates that latitude and longitude values are within valid ranges.

Classes/CLPlacemark.html#/s:16OpenCoreLo.name: region
Classes/CLPlacemark.html#/s:16OpenCoreLo.abstract: The associated region of the placemark, if applicable.

Classes/CLPlacemark.html#/s:16OpenCoreLo.name: timeZone
Classes/CLPlacemark.html#/s:16OpenCoreLo.abstract: The time zone associated with the placemark.

Classes/CLPlacemark.html#/s:16OpenCoreLo.name: name
Classes/CLPlacemark.html#/s:16OpenCoreLo.abstract: The name of the place, typically used to label a point of interest.

Classes/CLPlacemark.html#/s:16OpenCoreLo.name: thoroughfare
Classes/CLPlacemark.html#/s:16OpenCoreLo.abstract: The street address of the placemark (e.g., “1 Infinite Loop”).

Classes/CLPlacemark.html#/s:16OpenCoreLo.name: locality
Classes/CLPlacemark.html#/s:16OpenCoreLo.abstract: The city or town of the placemark.

Classes/CLPlacemark.html#/s:16OpenCoreLo.name: subLocality
Classes/CLPlacemark.html#/s:16OpenCoreLo.abstract: The neighborhood or district of the placemark.

Classes/CLPlacemark.html#/s:16OpenCoreLo.name: administrativeArea

Classes/CLPlacemark.html#/s:16OpenCoreLo.name: subAdministrativeArea

Classes/CLPlacemark.html#/s:16OpenCoreLo.name: postalCode

Classes/CLPlacemark.html#/s:16OpenCoreLo.name: postalAddress

Classes/CLLocationSourceInformation.html.name: isSimulatedBySoftware

Classes/CLLocationSourceInformation.html.abstract: Indicates whether the location was generated by an external accessory, such as CarPlay or an MFi accessory.

Classes/CLLocationSourceInformation.html.name: init(softwareSimulationState:andExternalAccessoryState:)
Classes/CLLocationSourceInformation.html.abstract: Creates a CLLocationSourceInformation instance with the specified source metadata.

Classes/CLLocation.html#/s:16OpenCoreLoc.name: altitude
Classes/CLLocation.html#/s:16OpenCoreLoc.abstract: The altitude of the location in meters.

Classes/CLLocation.html#/s:16OpenCoreLoc.name: timestamp
Classes/CLLocation.html#/s:16OpenCoreLoc.abstract: The timestamp when the location was determined.

Classes/CLLocation.html#/s:16OpenCoreLoc.name: horizontalAccuracy
Classes/CLLocation.html#/s:16OpenCoreLoc.abstract: The horizontal accuracy of the location in meters.

Classes/CLLocation.html#/s:16OpenCoreLoc.name: verticalAccuracy
Classes/CLLocation.html#/s:16OpenCoreLoc.abstract: The vertical accuracy of the location in meters.

Classes/CLLocation.html#/s:16OpenCoreLoc.name: course
Classes/CLLocation.html#/s:16OpenCoreLoc.abstract: The direction of travel of the device in degrees relative to true north.

Classes/CLLocation.html#/s:16OpenCoreLoc.name: courseAccuracy
Classes/CLLocation.html#/s:16OpenCoreLoc.abstract: The accuracy of the course measurement in degrees.

Classes/CLLocation.html#/s:16OpenCoreLoc.name: speed
Classes/CLLocation.html#/s:16OpenCoreLoc.abstract: The speed of the device in meters per second.

Classes/CLLocation.html#/s:16OpenCoreLoc.name: speedAccuracy
Classes/CLLocation.html#/s:16OpenCoreLoc.abstract: The accuracy of the speed measurement in meters per second.

Classes/CLLocation.html#/s:16OpenCoreLoc.name: floor
Classes/CLLocation.html#/s:16OpenCoreLoc.abstract: The floor level of the location (if available).

Classes/CLLocation.html#/s:16OpenCoreLoc.name: sourceInformation
Classes/CLLocation.html#/s:16OpenCoreLoc.abstract: Additional source information about how the location was determined.

Classes/CLLocation.html#/s:16OpenCoreLoc.name: init(latitude:longitude:)
Classes/CLLocation.html#/s:16OpenCoreLoc.abstract: Initializes a new CLLocation object with latitude and longitude.

Classes/CLLocation.html#/s:16OpenCoreLoc.name: init(coordinate:altitude:horizontalAccuracy:verticalAccuracy:course:courseAccuracy:speed:speedAccuracy:timestamp:floor:sourceInformation:)
Classes/CLLocation.html#/s:16OpenCoreLoc.abstract: Initializes a CLLocation with full details including altitude, accuracy, speed, and course.

Classes/CLLocation.html#/s:16OpenCoreLoc.name: distance(from:)
Classes/CLLocation.html#/s:16OpenCoreLoc.abstract: Computes the great-circle distance between two locations.

Classes/CLHeading.html#/s:16OpenCoreLoca.name: magneticHeading
Classes/CLHeading.html#/s:16OpenCoreLoca.abstract: The heading relative to the magnetic North Pole.

Classes/CLHeading.html#/s:16OpenCoreLoca.name: trueHeading
Classes/CLHeading.html#/s:16OpenCoreLoca.abstract: The heading relative to the geographic North Pole.

Classes/CLHeading.html#/s:16OpenCoreLoca.name: headingAccuracy
Classes/CLHeading.html#/s:16OpenCoreLoca.abstract: The accuracy of the heading data in degrees.

Classes/CLHeading.html#/s:16OpenCoreLoca.name: timestamp
Classes/CLHeading.html#/s:16OpenCoreLoca.abstract: The timestamp when the heading was determined.

Classes/CLFloor.html#/s:16OpenCoreLocati.name: level
Classes/CLFloor.html#/s:16OpenCoreLocati.abstract: The floor level relative to the ground floor.

Classes/CLFloor.html#/s:16OpenCoreLocati.name: init(level:)
Classes/CLFloor.html#/s:16OpenCoreLocati.abstract: Creates a CLFloor instance with the specified floor level.

Classes/CLCircularRegion.html#/s:16OpenC.name: init(center:radius:identifier:)
Classes/CLCircularRegion.html#/s:16OpenC.abstract: Creates a circular region with the specified center point and radius.

Classes/CLCircularRegion.html#/s:16OpenC.name: contains(_:)
Classes/CLCircularRegion.html#/s:16OpenC.abstract: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the specified coordinate is inside the region.

Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.name: delegate
Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.abstract: The delegate object to receive update events.

Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.name: authorizationStatus
Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.abstract: The current authorization status for the app.

Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.name: accuracyAuthorization
Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.abstract: The level of location accuracy the app has permission to use.

Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.name: isAuthorizedForWidgetUpdates
Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.abstract: Indicates whether a widget is eligible to receive location updates.

Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.name: activityType
Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.abstract: The type of activity the app expects the user to perform during location updates.

Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.name: distanceFilter
Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.abstract: The minimum distance (measured in meters) a device must move before an update event is generated.

Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.name: desiredAccuracy
Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.abstract: The accuracy of the location data that your app wants to receive.

Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.name: pausesLocationUpdatesAutomatically
Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.abstract: A Boolean value that indicates whether the location manager may pause location updates.

Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.name: allowsBackgroundLocationUpdates
Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.abstract: A Boolean value that indicates whether the app receives location updates when running in the background.

Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.name: location
Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.abstract: The most recently retrieved user location.

Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.name: headingFilter
Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.abstract: The minimum angular change (measured in degrees) required to generate new heading events.

Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.name: headingOrientation
Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.abstract: The device orientation to use when computing heading values.

Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.name: heading
Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.abstract: The most recently reported heading.

Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.name: maximumRegionMonitoringDistance
Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.abstract: The largest boundary distance that can be assigned to a region.

Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.name: monitoredRegions
Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.abstract: The set of shared regions monitored by all location-manager objects.

Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.name: rangedBeaconConstraints
Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.abstract: The set of beacon constraints currently being tracked using ranging.

Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.name: requestWhenInUseAuthorization()
Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.abstract: Undocumented

Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.name: requestAlwaysAuthorization()
Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.abstract: Undocumented

Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.name: requestTemporaryFullAccuracyAuthorization(withPurposeKey:completion:)
Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.abstract: Undocumented

Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.name: startUpdatingLocation()
Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.abstract: Starts the generation of updates that report the user’s current location.

Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.name: stopUpdatingLocation()
Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.abstract: Stops all location updates

Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.name: requestLocation()
Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.abstract: Requests the one-time delivery of the user’s current location.

Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.name: startUpdatingHeading()
Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.abstract: Starts the generation of updates that report the user’s current heading.

Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.name: stopUpdatingHeading()
Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.abstract: Stops the generation of heading updates.

Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.name: startMonitoring(for:)
Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.abstract: Starts monitoring the specified region for entry and exit events.

Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.name: stopMonitoring(for:)
Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.abstract: Stops monitoring the specified region.

Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.name: requestState(for:)
Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.abstract: Requests the current state of the specified region.

Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.name: locationServicesEnabled()
Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.abstract: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether location services are enabled on the device.

Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.name: headingAvailable()
Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.abstract: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the location manager is able to generate heading-related events.

Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.name: significantLocationChangeMonitoringAvailable()
Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.abstract: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the significant-change location service is available on the device.

Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.name: isMonitoringAvailable(for:)
Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.abstract: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the device supports region monitoring using the specified class.

Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.name: isRangingAvailable()
Classes/CLLocationManager.html#/s:16Open.abstract: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the device supports ranging of beacons that use the iBeacon protocol.

Classes/CLGeocoder.html#/s:16OpenCoreLoc.name: isGeocoding
Classes/CLGeocoder.html#/s:16OpenCoreLoc.abstract: A Boolean value indicating whether the geocoder is actively processing a request.

Classes/CLGeocoder.html#/c:@M@OpenCoreLo.name: init()
Classes/CLGeocoder.html#/c:@M@OpenCoreLo.abstract: Creates a geocoder instance for converting between geographic coordinates and user-friendly location information.

Classes/CLGeocoder.html#/s:16OpenCoreLoc.name: geocodeAddressString(_:completionHandler:)
Classes/CLGeocoder.html#/s:16OpenCoreLoc.abstract: Initiates a forward geocoding request to convert an address into one or more locations.

Classes/CLGeocoder.html#/s:16OpenCoreLoc.name: geocodeAddressString(_:in:completionHandler:)
Classes/CLGeocoder.html#/s:16OpenCoreLoc.abstract: Initiates a forward geocoding request with a search region constraint.

Classes/CLGeocoder.html#/s:16OpenCoreLoc.name: geocodeAddressString(_:in:)
Classes/CLGeocoder.html#/s:16OpenCoreLoc.abstract: Initiates an asynchronous forward geocoding request with a search region constraint.

Classes/CLGeocoder.html#/s:16OpenCoreLoc.name: reverseGeocodeLocation(_:completionHandler:)
Classes/CLGeocoder.html#/s:16OpenCoreLoc.abstract: Initiates a reverse geocoding request to convert a coordinate into user-friendly location information.

Classes/CLGeocoder.html#/s:16OpenCoreLoc.name: geocodePostalAddress(_:completionHandler:)
Classes/CLGeocoder.html#/s:16OpenCoreLoc.abstract: Initiates a geocoding request to convert a postal address into coordinates.

Classes/CLGeocoder.html#/s:16OpenCoreLoc.name: geocodePostalAddress(_:)
Classes/CLGeocoder.html#/s:16OpenCoreLoc.abstract: Initiates an asynchronous geocoding request for a postal address.

Classes/CLGeocoder.html.name: CLGeocoder
Classes/CLGeocoder.html.abstract: An object that provides services for converting between a coordinate and user-friendly location information.

Classes/CLLocationManager.html.name: CLLocationManager
Classes/CLLocationManager.html.abstract: The object you use to start and stop the delivery of location-related events to your app.

Classes/CLCircularRegion.html.name: CLCircularRegion
Classes/CLCircularRegion.html.abstract: A circular geographic region that you monitor using location services.

Classes/CLFloor.html.name: CLFloor
Classes/CLFloor.html.abstract: Represents the logical floor level of a location inside a building.

Classes/CLHeading.html.name: CLHeading
Classes/CLHeading.html.abstract: Represents the heading information of a device.

Classes/CLLocation.html.name: CLLocation
Classes/CLLocation.html.abstract: Represents a geographical coordinate along with accuracy, timestamp, and motion information.

Classes/CLLocationSourceInformation.html.name: CLLocationSourceInformation
Classes/CLLocationSourceInformation.html.abstract: Contains metadata about the source of a location, including whether it was generated by a simulator or an external accessory.

Classes/CLPlacemark.html.name: CLPlacemark
Classes/CLPlacemark.html.abstract: A structure that contains placemark data for a given latitude and longitude.

Classes/CLRegion.html.name: CLRegion
Classes/CLRegion.html.abstract: A geographic region that you monitor using location services.

Classes/CLLocationUtils.html.name: CLLocationUtils
Classes/CLLocationUtils.html.abstract: Utility functions for location calculations and coordinate operations.

Global%20Variables.html.abstract: The following global variables are available globally.

Typealiases.html.abstract: The following type aliases are available globally.
